@maiab @rsg I _have_ had some wonderful US agents. This older gentleman at the Vermont border who talked up my whole family. Really sweet guy. Or the one guy who let me in with only my driver‚Äôs license when I forgot my passport at home.
@rsg Tell me about how it‚Äôd be the govt‚Äôs fault if you didn‚Äôt bring your passport to the airport and how it‚Äôd be better if we were all a little more libertarian.

@rsg The US‚Äôs mindset of personal autonomy even if it steps on someone else‚Äôs autonomy is how we got into this mess. 

And had you planned better, a simple 15 minutes at a local pharmacy would‚Äôve saved you time and stress. But sure, blame the govt on your lack of planning.

@rsg I sure as hell don‚Äôt need more dumb as fuck protesters shitting on my doorstep because they think the Canadian govt has control over US laws. And considering you‚Äôve been equally duped has me concerned.
@rsg Dude, reframe it: ‚ÄúGetting into Canada is easier than getting into the US.‚Äù Notice how it frames the US as the problem and not Canada? Be better. This is your country‚Äôs rules, not ours.

@jaminjantz @whale They have been seizing vehicles that were left downtown. They haven‚Äôt seized any vehicles of anybody who left of their own accord. They have frozen (not seized) bank accounts, preventing money from being used to fund operation.

@jaminjantz @whale Only those participating in the occupation or funding the occupation when the Emergency Act was enacted are affected by the legislation. The powers this offers isn‚Äôt as broad as people seem to think.

@jaminjantz @whale I‚Äôm not saying whether it‚Äôs justified or not. I‚Äôm saying that these laws aren‚Äôt new and not special to Canada. And these funds are being used in the commission of a crime: financing an illegal occupation. Their houses nor vehicles not used in the occupation were not seized.
@jaminjantz @whale Read https://t.co/EOJra0x1Je for more.

@jaminjantz @whale In the US, as in Canada, bank accounts can be frozen if they suspect the funds are being used illegally. A conviction isn't required. Laws were broken by specific people and the bank accounts of those who broke the law had their accounts frozen.
Also, invite people over to harass you, defecate on your front lawn for the full experience. But don't worry, they get bouncy castles.

Do me a favour: turn on every speaker in your house and blare them for the next three weeks. No, you don't get to turn them off. No, I don't care if your kids are traumatized. No, I don't care if your pets are yelling. Three weeks. Until then, shut the fuck up.

Which is interesting to consider because making more mistakes doesn‚Äôt sound good but noticing and correcting mistakes sounds good‚Äîeven though the current state is technically the same. Question is, is past self worse or will future self be worse?
Like, I notice that I‚Äôm making more homonym mistakes these days (daze) but maybe I always did and I‚Äôm just noticing them now.
As I get older, I can‚Äôt tell if some things are worse or if I‚Äôve just become more aware things.
